fr.cyann.react

Class Signal<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.cyann.react.Signal<V>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractReact, Var

    public class Signal<V>
extends java.lang.Object
    The Signal class. Define the base class of all discrete and continous react. Creation date: 11 oct. 2013.
    Version:
    v0.1
    Author:
    Yann Caron

    • Method Detail

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Get if signal is started.
        Returns:
        true if started, false otherwise.

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the chained signals to emit.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the chained signals to emit.
        Has influence on events only. Var and operations continues to emit.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Stop then start the chained signals.

      • emit

        public void emit(V value)
        Command react to emit a signal.
        Should be overrided to add automatic behaviours like emit counter time management etc.

      • subscribe

        public Signal<V> subscribe(Procedure1<V> subscriber)
        Register listener first order function to react. Function will be called when event is raised.
        Parameters:
        subscriber - function to be called in case of event.
        Returns:
        return this.

      • dump

        public Signal<V> dump(Signal<V> signal)

      • unSubscribe

        public Signal<V> unSubscribe(Procedure1<V> subscriber)

      • filter

        public Signal<V> filter(Predicate1<V> function)
        Filter the event according a criteria.
        Parameters:
        function - predicate to filter. If result is true, event pass else it is blocked.
        Returns:
        the new filtered signal.

      • filterFold

        public Signal<V> filterFold(V initialize,
                   Predicate2<V,V> filter)
        Filter the event according a criteria on the value and it's previous.
        Finish signal is not filtered.
        Parameters:
        initialize - the first value to compare signal value.
        filter - predicate to filter. If result is true, event pass else it is blocked.
        Returns:
        the new filtered signal.

      • filterFold

        public Signal<V> filterFold(V initEmit,
                   Predicate2<V,V> fEmit,
                   V initFinish,
                   Predicate2<V,V> fFinish)
        Filter the event according a criteria on the value and it's previous.
        Parameters:
        initEmit - the first value to compare signal value.
        fEmit - predicate to filter. If result is true, event pass else it is blocked.
        initFinish - the first value to compare finish signal value.
        fFinish - predicate to filter finish. If result is true, event pass else it is blocked.
        Returns:
        the new filtered signal.

      • map

        public <R> Signal<R> map(Function1<V,R> function)
        Transform the react's value according the supplied function.
        Type Parameters:
        R - The transformed react's value data type.
        Parameters:
        function - the function to transform data.
        Returns:
        the new transformed react.

      • fold

        public Signal<V> fold(Function2<V,V,V> function)
        Fold current value with previous one. Finish signal is transformed with the same functor.
        Parameters:
        function - specify the action to perform between previous value and current.
        Returns:
        the new value.

      • fold

        public <W> Var<W> fold(W initialize,
              Function2<W,V,W> function)
        Fold current value with previous one. Finish signal is transformed with the same functor.
        Parameters:
        function - specify the action to perform between previous value and current.
        initialize - the first value to fold.
        Returns:
        the new value.

      • edge

        public Signal<V> edge(Signal<java.lang.Boolean> edge)
        When input signal (edge one) emit signal, this signal can emit, otherwise signals are skipped.
        Run like an electronical bipolar junction transistor.... haaa 2N2222...
        Parameters:
        edge - the filter signal to filter on.
        Returns:
        the resulting signal.

      • switchMap

        public <R> Signal<R> switchMap(V init,
                      Function1<V,Signal<R>> function)
        Like map, but return value is signal.
        Be carefull signal is disposed after usage. Alwayse create a new one.
        Type Parameters:
        R - The transformed react's value data type.
        Parameters:
        init - the initial value
        function - the function to transform data.
        Returns:
        the signal react.

      • feedBackLoop

        public Signal<V> feedBackLoop(Function1<V,Signal> function)
        Feedback signal emited by function is created after each current signal are emited.
        The resulting signal wait after feedback to emit in its turn.
        This method can be used to smooth fitful signals or wait after feedback events (works like a control system).
        Parameters:
        function - the function that produce the feedback signal.
        Returns:
        the resulting signal.

      • mergeSame

        public Signal<V> mergeSame(Signal<V> right)

      • merge

        public <W> Var<Tuple<V,W>> merge(V init,
                        W initMerge,
                        Signal<W> right)
        See Also:
        merge(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object, fr.cyann.react.Signal, fr.cyann.functional.Function2)

      • merge

        public <X,W> Var<X> merge(V init,
                 W initMerge,
                 Signal<W> right,
                 Function2<V,W,X> mapfold)
        Associative method.
        Merge two signal together. If any signal emit, the resulting signal will emit. Consider this operation like an or boolean operation.
        Type Parameters:
        X - Type of the resulting var.
        W - Type of the merged var.
        Parameters:
        init - the initial value of signal.
        initMerge - the initial value of mergeSame signal.
        right - the var to mergeSame with.
        mapfold - the map fold transformation function.
        It's goal is to mergeSame the two values together and returned in the desired type.
        Returns:
        the new merged signal.

      • sync

        public <W> Var<Tuple<V,W>> sync(V init,
                       W initMerge,
                       Signal<W> right)
        See Also:
        sync(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object, fr.cyann.react.Signal, fr.cyann.functional.Function2)

      • sync

        public final <X,W> Var<X> sync(V init,
                W initSync,
                Signal<W> right,
                Function2<V,W,X> mapfold)
        Associative method.
        Synchronize signal together. The both signals should be before resulting signal will be emited.
        Consider this operation like an and boolean operation.
        Type Parameters:
        X - Type of the resulting var.
        W - Type of the sync var.
        Parameters:
        init - the initial value of signal.
        initSync - the initial value of mergeSame signal.
        right - the var to mergeSame with.
        mapfold - the map fold transformation function.
        It's goal is to mergeSame the two values together and returned in the desired type.
        Returns:
        the new merged signal.

      • then

        public <W> Var<Tuple<V,W>> then(V init,
                       W initMerge,
                       Signal<W> right)
        See Also:
        then(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object, fr.cyann.react.Signal, fr.cyann.functional.Function2)

      • then

        public <W,X> Var<X> then(V init,
                W initThen,
                Signal<W> right,
                Function2<V,W,X> mapfold)
        Associative method.
        Synchronize signal together. The first then the second signals should be emited before resulting signal will emit.
        Type Parameters:
        X - Type of the resulting var.
        W - Type of the then var.
        Parameters:
        init - the initial value of signal.
        initThen - the initial value of then signal.
        right - the var to mergeSame with.
        mapfold - the map fold transformation function.
        It's goal is to mergeSame the two values together and returned in the desired type.
        Returns:
        the new merged signal.

      • when

        public <W> Var<Tuple<V,W>> when(V init,
                       W initMerge,
                       Signal<W> right)
        See Also:

      • when

        public <W,X> Var<X> when(V init,
                W initWhen,
                Signal<W> right,
                Function2<V,W,X> mapfold)
        Associative method.
        Synchronize signal together. The second then the first signals should be emited before resulting signal will emit.
        Type Parameters:
        X - Type of the resulting var.
        W - Type of the when var.
        Parameters:
        init - the initial value of signal.
        initWhen - the initial value of then signal.
        right - the var to mergeSame with.
        mapfold - the map fold transformation function.
        It's goal is to mergeSame the two values together and returned in the desired type.
        Returns:
        the new merged signal.

      • weak

        public Signal<V> weak()
        Break link for dispose mechanism. The weak signal will not be disposed when linked signal is disposed.
        Returns:
        The weak signal.
